result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney L Clark Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $273.96 to Walmart on this case and $150.52 to Walmart on the dismissed case (16CM23) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No contact with Walmart

Case 16CM23 was dismissed and read into: 16CM22.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
Credit 77 days.

Fines to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month, commencing 7/01/2017;
alternate 8 days jail.
Any restitution to be converted to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
jail

Defendant Rodney L Clark in court, in custody, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State makes sentencing arguments.  Defense makes sentencing arguments.  Defendant was sentenced as follows:

6 MONTHS JAIL STRAIGHT (CREDIT - 77 days)

Outstanding fines to be paid at the rate of $25/month starting July 1, 2017 or serve 8 days jail for failure to pay.

Previously ordered restitution shall be converted to a civil judgment.  

Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County upon their approval.
Notice of Hearing returned
From Milwaukee County Jail for 12/16/16 hearing @ 10:00
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
